You need to ensure reliability for your.A: Using the Cron service provided by App Engine, publish messages directly to a message-processing utility service running on Compute Engine instances.
You need to ensure reliability for your.B: Using the Cron service provided by App Engine, publish messages to a Cloud Pub/Sub topic. Subscribe to that topic using a message-processing utility service running on Compute Engine instances.
You need to ensure reliability for your.C: Using the Cron service provided by Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE), publish messages directly to a message-processing utility service running on Compute Engine instances.
You need to ensure reliability for your.D: Using the Cron service provided by GKE, publish messages to a Cloud Pub/Sub topic. Subscribe to that topic using a message-processing utility service running on Compute Engine instances.

Your company is building a new architect.A: Compress and upload both archived files and files uploaded daily using the gsutil m option.
Your company is building a new architect.B: Lease a Transfer Appliance, upload archived files to it, and send it to Google to transfer archived data to Cloud Storage. Establish a connection with Google using a Dedicated Interconnect or Direct Peering connection and use it to upload files daily.
Your company is building a new architect.C: Lease a Transfer Appliance, upload archived files to it, and send it to Google to transfer archived data to Cloud Storage. Establish one Cloud VPN Tunnel to VPC networks over the public internet, and compress and upload files daily using the gsutil m option.
Your company is building a new architect.D: Lease a Transfer Appliance, upload archived files to it, and send it to Google to transfer archived data to Cloud Storage. Establish a Cloud VPN Tunnel to VPC networks over the public internet, and compress and upload files daily.

Your company is planning to perform a li.A: 1. Define a migration plan based on the list of the applications and their dependencies. 2. Migrate all virtual machines into Compute Engine individually with Migrate for Compute Engine.
Your company is planning to perform a li.B: 1. Perform an assessment of virtual machines running in the current VMware environment. 2. Create images of all disks. Import disks on Compute Engine. 3. Create standard virtual machines where the boot disks are the ones you have imported.
Your company is planning to perform a li.C: 1. Perform an assessment of virtual machines running in the current VMware environment. 2. Define a migration plan, prepare a Migrate for Compute Engine migration RunBook, and execute the migration.
Your company is planning to perform a li.D: 1. Perform an assessment of virtual machines running in the current VMware environment. 2. Install a third-party agent on all selected virtual machines. 3. Migrate all virtual machines into Compute Engine.

You need to deploy an application to Goo.A: Use a managed instance group with instances in multiple zones, use Cloud Filestore, and use an HTTP load balancer in front of the instances.
You need to deploy an application to Goo.B: Use a managed instance group with instances in multiple zones, use Cloud Filestore, and use a network load balancer in front of the instances.
You need to deploy an application to Goo.C: Use an unmanaged instance group with an active and standby instance in different zones, use a regional persistent disk, and use an HTTP load balancer in front of the instances.
You need to deploy an application to Goo.D: Use an unmanaged instance group with an active and standby instance in different zones, use a regional persistent disk, and use a network load balancer in front of the instances.

Your company has an application running.A: Use OpenVPN to configure a VPN tunnel between the on-premises environment and Google Cloud.
Your company has an application running.B: Configure a direct peering connection between the on-premises environment and Google Cloud.
Your company has an application running.C: Use Cloud VPN to configure a VPN tunnel between the on-premises environment and Google Cloud.
Your company has an application running.D: Configure a Cloud Dedicated Interconnect connection between the on-premises environment and Google Cloud.

You are managing an application deployed.A: Deploy a new revision to Cloud Run with the new version. Configure traffic percentage between revisions.
You are managing an application deployed.B: Deploy a new service to Cloud Run with the new version. Add a Cloud Load Balancing instance in front of both services.
You are managing an application deployed.C: In the Google Cloud Console page for Cloud Run, set up continuous deployment using Cloud Build for the development branch. As part of the Cloud Build trigger, configure the substitution variable TRAFFIC_PERCENTAGE with the percentage of traffic you want directed to a new version.
You are managing an application deployed.D: In the Google Cloud Console, configure Traffic Director with a new Service that points to the new version of the application on Cloud Run. Configure Traffic Director to send a small percentage of traffic to the new version of the application.

You are monitoring Google Kubernetes Eng.A: Navigate the predefined dashboards in the Cloud Monitoring workspace, and then add metrics and create alert policies.
You are monitoring Google Kubernetes Eng.B: Navigate the predefined dashboards in the Cloud Monitoring workspace, create custom metrics, and install alerting software on a Compute Engine instance.
You are monitoring Google Kubernetes Eng.C: Write a shell script that gathers metrics from GKE nodes, publish these metrics to a Pub/Sub topic, export the data to BigQuery, and make a Data Studio dashboard.
You are monitoring Google Kubernetes Eng.D: Create a custom dashboard in the Cloud Monitoring workspace for each incident, and then add metrics and create alert policies.

You are working at a sports association.A: Use a unique identifier for each individual. Upon a deletion request, delete all rows from BigQuery with this identifier.
You are working at a sports association.B: When ingesting new data in BigQuery, run the data through the Data Loss Prevention (DLP) API to identify any personal information. As part of the DLP scan, save the result to Data Catalog. Upon a deletion request, query Data Catalog to find the column with personal information.
You are working at a sports association.C: Create a BigQuery view over the table that contains all data. Upon a deletion request, exclude the rows that affect the subject's data from this view. Use this view instead of the source table for all analysis tasks.
You are working at a sports association.D: Use a unique identifier for each individual. Upon a deletion request, overwrite the column with the unique identifier with a salted SHA256 of its value.

Your company is running its application.A: Create a shell script that uses the gcloud command to change the machine type of the development and acceptance instances to a smaller machine type outside of office hours. Schedule the shell script on one of the production instances to automate the task.
Your company is running its application.B: Use Cloud Scheduler to trigger a Cloud Function that will stop the development and acceptance environments after office hours and start them just before office hours.
Your company is running its application.C: Deploy the development and acceptance applications on a managed instance group and enable autoscaling.
Your company is running its application.D: Use regular Compute Engine instances for the production environment, and use preemptible VMs for the acceptance and development environments.

You are moving an application that uses.A: 1. Set up Cloud VPN to provide private network connectivity between the Compute Engine application and the on-premises MySQL server. 2. Stop the on-premises application. 3. Create a mysqldump of the on-premises MySQL server. 4. Upload the dump to a Cloud Storage bucket. 5. Import the dump into Cloud SQL. 6. Modify the source code of the application to write queries to both databases and read from its local database. 7. Start the Compute Engine application. 8. Stop the on-premises application.
You are moving an application that uses.B: 1. Set up Cloud SQL proxy and MySQL proxy. 2. Create a mysqldump of the on-premises MySQL server. 3. Upload the dump to a Cloud Storage bucket. 4. Import the dump into Cloud SQL. 5. Stop the on-premises application. 6. Start the Compute Engine application.
You are moving an application that uses.C: 1. Set up Cloud VPN to provide private network connectivity between the Compute Engine application and the on-premises MySQL server. 2. Stop the on-premises application. 3. Start the Compute Engine application, configured to read and write to the on-premises MySQL server. 4. Create the replication configuration in Cloud SQL. 5. Configure the source database server to accept connections from the Cloud SQL replica. 6. Finalize the Cloud SQL replica configuration. 7. When replication has been completed, stop the Compute Engine application. 8. Promote the Cloud SQL replica to a standalone instance. 9. Restart the Compute Engine application, configured to read and write to the Cloud SQL standalone instance.
You are moving an application that uses.D: 1. Stop the on-premises application. 2. Create a mysqldump of the on-premises MySQL server. 3. Upload the dump to a Cloud Storage bucket. 4. Import the dump into Cloud SQL. 5. Start the application on Compute Engine.

Your organization has decided to restric.A: Remove the default route on all VPCs. Move all approved instances into a new subnet that has a default route to an internet gateway.
Your organization has decided to restric.B: Create a new VPC in custom mode. Create a new subnet for the approved instances, and set a default route to the internet gateway on this new subnet.
Your organization has decided to restric.C: Implement a Cloud NAT solution to remove the need for external IP addresses entirely.
Your organization has decided to restric.D: Set an Organization Policy with a constraint on constraints/compute.vmExternalIpAccess. List the approved instances in the allowedValues list.

Your company uses the Firewall Insights.A: Enable Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) flow logging.
Your company uses the Firewall Insights.B: Enable Firewall Rules Logging for the firewall rules you want to monitor.
Your company uses the Firewall Insights.C: Verify that your user account is assigned the compute.networkAdmin Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
Your company uses the Firewall Insights.D: Install the Google Cloud SDK, and verify that there are no Firewall logs in the command line output.

Your company has sensitive data in Cloud.A: 1. Create a VPC Service Controls perimeter that includes the projects with the buckets. 2. Create an access level with the CIDR of the office network.
Your company has sensitive data in Cloud.B: 1. Create a firewall rule for all instances in the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network for source range. 2. Use the Classless Inter-domain Routing (CIDR) of the office network.
Your company has sensitive data in Cloud.C: 1. Create a Cloud Function to remove IAM permissions from the buckets, and another Cloud Function to add IAM permissions to the buckets. 2. Schedule the Cloud Functions with Cloud Scheduler to add permissions at the start of business and remove permissions at the end of business.
Your company has sensitive data in Cloud.D: 1. Create a Cloud VPN to the office network. 2. Configure Private Google Access for on-premises hosts.

You have developed a non-critical update.A: Start a new rolling restart operation.
You have developed a non-critical update.B: Start a new rolling replace operation.
You have developed a non-critical update.C: Start a new rolling update. Select the Proactive update mode.
You have developed a non-critical update.D: Start a new rolling update. Select the Opportunistic update mode.

Your company is designing its applicatio.A: Create a snapshot schedule for the disk containing the application data. Whenever a zonal outage occurs, use the latest snapshot to restore the disk in the same zone.
Your company is designing its applicatio.B: Configure the Compute Engine instances with an instance template for the application, and use a regional persistent disk for the application data. Whenever a zonal outage occurs, use the instance template to spin up the application in another zone in the same region. Use the regional persistent disk for the application data.
Your company is designing its applicatio.C: Create a snapshot schedule for the disk containing the application data. Whenever a zonal outage occurs, use the latest snapshot to restore the disk in another zone within the same region.
Your company is designing its applicatio.D: Configure the Compute Engine instances with an instance template for the application, and use a regional persistent disk for the application data. Whenever a zonal outage occurs, use the instance template to spin up the application in another region. Use the regional persistent disk for the application data.

Your company has just acquired another c.A: Create a Cloud VPN connection from the new VPC to the data center, create a Cloud Router, and apply new IP addresses so there is no overlapping IP space.
Your company has just acquired another c.B: Create a Cloud VPN connection from the new VPC to the data center, and create a Cloud NAT instance to perform NAT on the overlapping IP space.
Your company has just acquired another c.C: Create a Cloud VPN connection from the new VPC to the data center, create a Cloud Router, and apply a custom route advertisement to block the overlapping IP space.
Your company has just acquired another c.D: Create a Cloud VPN connection from the new VPC to the data center, and apply a firewall rule that blocks the overlapping IP space.

You need to migrate Hadoop jobs for your.A: Create a Dataproc cluster using standard worker instances.
You need to migrate Hadoop jobs for your.B: Create a Dataproc cluster using preemptible worker instances.
You need to migrate Hadoop jobs for your.C: Manually deploy a Hadoop cluster on Compute Engine using standard instances.
You need to migrate Hadoop jobs for your.D: Manually deploy a Hadoop cluster on Compute Engine using preemptible instances.

You need to deploy an application on Goo.A: Create a Compute Engine instance template using the most recent Debian image. Create an instance from this template, and install and configure the application as part of the startup script. Repeat this process whenever a new Google-managed Debian image becomes available.
You need to deploy an application on Goo.B: Create a Debian-based Compute Engine instance, install and configure the application, and use OS patch management to install available updates.
You need to deploy an application on Goo.C: Create an instance with the latest available Debian image. Connect to the instance via SSH, and install and configure the application on the instance. Repeat this process whenever a new Google-managed Debian image becomes available.
You need to deploy an application on Goo.D: Create a Docker container with Debian as the base image. Install and configure the application as part of the Docker image creation process. Host the container on Google Kubernetes Engine and restart the container whenever a new update is available.

You have an application that runs in Goo.A: 1. Update your GKE cluster to use Cloud Operations for GKE. 2. Use the GKE Monitoring dashboard to investigate logs from affected Pods.
You have an application that runs in Goo.B: 1. Create a new GKE cluster with Cloud Operations for GKE enabled. 2. Migrate the affected Pods to the new cluster, and redirect traffic for those Pods to the new cluster. 3. Use the GKE Monitoring dashboard to investigate logs from affected Pods.
You have an application that runs in Goo.C: 1. Update your GKE cluster to use Cloud Operations for GKE, and deploy Prometheus. 2. Set an alert to trigger whenever the application returns an error.
You have an application that runs in Goo.D: 1. Create a new GKE cluster with Cloud Operations for GKE enabled, and deploy Prometheus. 2. Migrate the affected Pods to the new cluster, and redirect traffic for those Pods to the new cluster. 3. Set an alert to trigger whenever the application returns an error.

You need to deploy a stateful workload o.A: Use a persistent disk for each instance.
You need to deploy a stateful workload o.B: Use a regional persistent disk for each instance.
You need to deploy a stateful workload o.C: Create a Cloud Filestore instance and mount it in each instance.
You need to deploy a stateful workload o.D: Create a Cloud Storage bucket and mount it in each instance using gcsfuse.

Your company has an application deployed.A: Use the Service Mesh visualization in the Cloud Console to inspect the telemetry between the microservices.
Your company has an application deployed.B: Use Anthos Config Management to create a ClusterSelector selecting the relevant cluster. On the Google Cloud Console page for Google Kubernetes Engine, view the Workloads and filter on the cluster. Inspect the configurations of the filtered workloads.
Your company has an application deployed.C: Use Anthos Config Management to create a namespaceSelector selecting the relevant cluster namespace. On the Google Cloud Console page for Google Kubernetes Engine, visit the workloads and filter on the namespace. Inspect the configurations of the filtered workloads.
Your company has an application deployed.D: Reinstall istio using the default istio profile in order to collect request latency. Evaluate the telemetry between the microservices in the Cloud Console

You are working at a financial instituti.A: Create a retention policy on the bucket for the duration of 5 years. Create a lock on the retention policy.
You are working at a financial instituti.B: Create the bucket with uniform bucket-level access, and grant a service account the role of Object Writer. Use the service account to upload new files.
You are working at a financial instituti.C: Use a customer-managed key for the encryption of the bucket. Rotate the key after 5 years.
You are working at a financial instituti.D: Create the bucket with fine-grained access control, and grant a service account the role of Object Writer. Use the service account to upload new files.
